> > Why should i go for JUnit testing Framework which i
> > can accompolish in plain java class.?

Hi!

I started using JUnit some days ago. Why use it?

Well, i did all my testing based on (shell-)scripts till now. Working
in a (CVS-) developer team it's good to have a _unique_ style calling
all the different tests - and i think JUnit is _one_ of many possible
ways to provide a unique access for testing a whole project.

Imagine you have 20 people working on a project - everyone with a
different (and changing while learning) scripting- and testing style.
It would take a lot of time to get access to the tests and even more
time to understand and modify them.

This is no special reason for using JUnit, but it is a reason for a
common testing style. Since JUnit seems to work well and has evolved
over a longer period - why not try it?

Bye, Andi.
